p: Despite the possible limitations due to the lack of data on the frequency of gathering/use of medicinal plants recorded in the SeventiesÂ and the fact that a number of medicinal taxa are not commonly gathered and used nowadays (see Table 1), there was no remarkable quantitative difference between the two medical ethnobotanies (53 recorded herbal genera in the Seventies and 59 in the current study) but qualitatively the difference was substantial.
